resources.string: Add commas for multiple user keys. Leave blank to disable.

Enter a unique name for this instance of PiFire. This name is used as the root mqtt topic for this device. Changing it later will result in new mqtt topics being created, and if using Home Assistant will result in new sensors being created.
Enter the IP or host name of your mqtt broker and port. ex:homeassistant.local 1883
Leave the username and password blank if your broker does not require authentication
Specify in seconds, how often you would like to publish PiFire data to the mqtt broker.
The Home Assistant MQTT integration. can automatically add PiFire and its devices if you specify the discovery topic name here

OneSignal is used to deliver notifications from PiFire. No Personally Identifiable Information is being collected by OneSignal. Notification data sent through OneSignal\'s API will be deleted after ~30 days.
Once you accept, this device will register with OneSignal. Consent can be revoked to prevent further communication with OneSignal.
OneSignal.com must not be blocked (e.g. in PiHole) for device registration to succeed
To receive notifications from PiFire consent to the OneSignal data privacy.
This device has not registered with OneSignal servers. Verify OneSignal.com is not blocked (e.g. PiHole) The registration process can take up to 2 minutes.
This device will attempt to register with your PiFire server now. This process can take a couple minutes.
There was an unexpected error with OneSignal. Please try again later.
OneSignal cannot obtain a push token from Google. If this device does not have Google Play Services installed push notifications will not be available
This device is not subscribed to OneSignal servers. Verify notifications for this app are not disabled in device settings. If notifications are not disabled the device will now attempt to subscribe
